title: statCTR
text:
This is a Quarto website for the statistical consulting training resources initiative. The website is hosted at statCTR.com.
It is currently mostly a placeholder. The To-do list is the “Issues” page; please create a new issue to add items to the to-do list for this website.

title: The Statistical Consulting Training Repository Initiative
text:
Welcome to StatCTR; a repository of publicly-contributed and publicly-available training resources for statistical consulting and collaboration. The goal of this website is to provide an open-sourced, community-driven repository for:

Training videos
Papers and online resources
Case studies

title: The Statistical Consulting Training Repository Initiative
section: Submit your video to our website!
text:
Submit your video to our website!
Everyone can submit their own video to this website via this form. New submissions will require the following:

A YouTube link to their video (see production requirements below)
A script
A set of discussion questions
An acknowledgement of our contributor code of conduct

Video requirements:

Videos must be audible. Closed-captioning should be provided if feasible (YouTube can do this automatically)
Videos must be under 6 minutes in length
Must conform to YouTube’s guidelines for all ages
All actors/contributors must consent to public distribution

We wish to encourage creativity! We only request that the script is constrained to being believable and within the realm of reality for a statistical consultant.
We will review all submitted videos and vote on whether to include the video in this repository, based on the following criteria: script quality and content, quality of discussion questions, and video production quality.

title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text:
Examples of unacceptable behavior include: use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances of any kind; trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks including gaslighting; public or private harassment; publishing or sharing others' private information without their explicit permission; and other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting.
Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, reject comments, videos, articles, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct. Project maintainers who do not follow the Code of Conduct may be removed from the project team.
Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the repository maintainers.
This Contributor Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 2.1 available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html.
